Share any unusual traditions or locations on campus
Who enjoy small campus' and disabled students who need accomodations and accessibility.
Join the Student body, volunteer Coaching for ESL, GED and Computer basic classes. Work at the library. Enjoy the winter sports on Mt. Baker, join a team for the annual Ski to Sea.
Great cafeteria food, restaurant and coffee bar.
Solid. The employers in the area help design courses by saying what they need on the job site. So you come away with some useful skills.

Great hand on education, the instructors are professionals from their respective fields. Most of them know what the industry needs. So spend time talking to them when you can. Use a planner, they are available here and will help you handle your classes and assignments professionally.
Small campus, easy to get around, and located at the edge of Bellingham city. Small class sizes, and help from the instructor. Friendly and helpful administration staff.
pageTitle: Bellingham Technical College Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {2310=September of 2009 I lost my job of 19 years at Philips Ultrasound in a large scale reduction in force. I researched my options carefully and found Bellingham Technical College to be well aligned with local industry. In just my first two quarters I have learned so much about my new field of industrial processes, especially petroleum refining and electric power generation., 37306=My quarterly tuition is about 2500. Equipment runs about another 500 depending on what you already have, but they tell you it's 2k. I'm learning an incredible amount in an insanely short time, and it beats the crap out of 4-year schools and $80k in debt. Downside is the communication between the school and incoming students is abysmal. I spent my summer haranguing them for information that should've been provided to new students when they registered and finally got the equipment list they told me would run about $2000 less than a week before term started. They cut a lot of the fat and stick to practical application classes, but be prepared for inordinate amounts of frustration while you're getting registered., 1181=Tuition and books are expensive, but relative to other community colleges, BTC is not out of line. Prices may vary widely between different classes and programs, but my full time schedule runs roughly $1300 per quarter for tuition and $310 per quarter for books., 43073=© 2015, Cappex.com, LLC}
